questions.info: If there is no stop line, crosswalk or sidewalk, stop at the intersection edge.

options.text: Stop if necessary and go when intersection is clear.

questions.info: Traffic in the intersection or traffic lose to it goes first. Only stop if necessary, then proceed when clear.
School zone signs are neon yellow or blue and 5-sided. Always reduce speed and watch for children.

options.text: School zone, reduce speed to 60 km/h.
Slow down, school zone ahead, watch for children and drive with extra caution.
You are approaching a school bus loading zone.

questions.info: Trains could be approaching so look both ways and be prepared to stop.

options.text: A railway crossing is X-shaped and filled in with red.
A railway crossing sign indicating railway tracks cross the road.

questions.info: For everyone's safety bicycles are not allowed.
This sign is usually in pairs or groups marking which areas you can park in.

options.text: Parking only allowed for longer than 30 minutes, 9am - 6pm.
Parking is allowed for a maximum of 30 minutes within times posted.

questions.info: If the traffic light is red at the intersection you may not turn right.

options.text: Turn right only on a red light.
No right turn allowed on a red light.

questions.info: Do not enter under any circumstance.
You can only park in this area if your vehicle displays a valid Accessible Parking Permit.

options.text: No parking at any time unless vehicle has a valid Accessible Parking Permit.
No stopping at any time unless vehicle has a valid Accessible Parking Permit.

questions.info: Vehicles must display a valid Accessible Parking Permit in order to sto to load and unload people with disabilities.

options.text: Curb area reserved for picking up and dropping off people with disabilities.
Curb area reserved for loading and unloading all passengers.
Curb area reserved for vehicles parking with a valid permit.
Curb area reserved for all vehicles after 6pm.

questions.info: Stopping is only allowed if loading or unloading passengers. This sign is used in groups or pairs.

options.text: You may stand in the area between the signs.
Bus stop is to the right and left.

questions.info: Do not turn around and go in the opposite direction.

options.text: You may go in the opposite direction.

questions.info: Besides no stopping, you are not allowed to load or unload passengers between signs that look like this.

options.text: No stopping except to unload passengers.
There is a stop sign ahead.
No stopping at any time between the signs.

questions.info: Carefully read the date and time as there is no left turn during days and times posted.

options.text: No left turn during days and times posted.
No left turn on Saturday or Sunday.

questions.info: When used in pairs, there is no parking between the signs unless you are loading or unloading people or merchandise.

options.text: Parking allowed on either side of the signs.
No parking allowed between the signs.
There is parking available on either side of the arrows.

questions.info: You are not allowed to drive through the intersection so be prepared to turn.

options.text: You are allowed to go straight through the intersection.
You are not allowed to go straight through the intersection.
You are not allowed to turn right or left.

questions.info: The speed is lower during school hours when the yellow lights are flashing. School sign may be neon yellow or blue.

options.text: You are approaching a school bus loading zone.
Reduce speed to 40 km/h at all times.
Reduce speed to 40 km/h when lights are flashing in this school zone.
Watch for pedestrians at the crosswalk.

questions.info: This sign is for multi-lane highways when there is no centre median divider.

options.text: You are approaching a school zone crosswalk.
You are entering a school zone.
All vehicles must stop on the side of the road where the school bus is.
All vehicles must stop for a school bus in all directions when lights are flashing.

questions.info: There is a traffic island ahead and you must keep to the right of it.

options.text: There is an intersection ahead on the right.
Stay to the left of the island.
Stay to the right of the island.
The road curves to the left for 1 km.

questions.info: The speed limit ahead is changing from what it is to 50 km/h.

options.text: The speed limit is 50 km/h ahead.
It is 50 km to the next rest area.
The speed limit is 50 km/h for a distance of 50 km.

questions.info: You can only travel in the direction of the arrow.

options.text: One-way traffic in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.info: Pedestrians are not allowed on this road.

options.text: Pedestrians may not cross this road.
There is no crosswalk in the area.

questions.info: For safety reasons there is no passing on this roadway.

options.text: You may pass on this road.

questions.info: You are permitted to pass on the left; otherwise, keep to the right.

options.text: Right turn and passing lane ahead.
Keep to the right except when passing on two-way road sections.

questions.info: You are approaching a pedestrian crosswalk. Slow down, yield to pedestrians and be prepared to stop.

options.text: Stop and yield right-of-way to pedestrians at crosswalk. Do not pass from sign to crossing.
Railroad crossing ahead, no pedestrians allowed.
Pedestrians or vehicles may not enter the roadway.

questions.info: These signs are either painted on the roadway or hung above at intersections. They tell drivers the direction they must travel for the lane they are in.

options.text: If you are in lanes 1, 2 or 3 you must only go in the direction of that lane's arrow.
If you are in lane 1 you may go straight and left.
If you are in lane 2 you may go in any direction.
If you are in lane 3, you may go straight or turn right.

questions.info: This sign can be above the ground or on the road which means two-way left turns only.

options.text: Lane is not for left turns.
Lane is only for two-way left turns.

questions.info: These lanes are for bicycles or specific vehicles that carry 3 or more people, for the times indicated or all the time if no time is shown.

options.text: Lanes are for pedestrians only, no vehicles permitted during days and times posted.
Lanes are for loading and unloading passengers only during days and times posted.
Lanes are for 5 or more passengers during days and times posted.
Lanes are for 3 or more passengers in the vehicles shown, plus bicycles, during the days and times shown or all the time (depending on the sign).

questions.info: You can not change lanes into or out of the HOV lanes.

options.text: No passing except to enter HOV lanes.
Do not cross lanes, sidewalk ahead.
Do not cross into or out of HOV lanes for area shown.

questions.info: When approaching an intersection with this sign the direction of the arrow indicates who has the right-of-way.

options.text: Crosswalk ahead, watch for pedestrians crossing.
Intersection ahead, direction of arrow indicates who has right-of-way.

questions.info: Drivers on the hidden road ahead may not see traffic from the main road when they reach the intersection.

options.text: There is a three-way stop ahead that is hidden.
There is a hidden road ahead.

questions.info: This symbol represents a bridge and that the bridge is narrower than the roadway.

options.text: Slower traffic move to the right.

questions.info: The pavement will become narrower ahead.

options.text: There is a narrow bridge ahead.

questions.info: Adjust driving accordingly as the road bends or curves slightly to the right.

options.text: The road bends to the right ahead.
The road bends to the left ahead.

questions.info: The road divides ahead. Slow down in case you or others have to turn off the main roadway.

options.text: There is a three-way stop ahead.

questions.info: These arrowheads are called chevrons. They warn you about the sharp turns and are posted in groups to guide drivers.
The road changes and bends sharply so reduce speed in order to follow the roadway safely.

options.text: Road turns or bends to the right sharply ahead.

questions.info: There is a stop sign ahead so slow down.
An island or something close to the road is a hazard. Downward lines indicate side to pass hazard on.

options.text: Hazard close to edge of road.

questions.info: The two-way road ahead will be split with a median. Each side of the road is one-way traffic.

options.text: Slower traffic keep to the right.
The two-way road ahead is split with a median.

questions.info: You will be required to share the road ahead with oncoming traffic. The road will not be divided with a median.

options.text: The two-way road ahead is not divided with a median.
The two-way road ahead is divided with a median.

questions.info: The road is winding ahead which may obstruct your ability to see other vehicles.

options.text: Sharp turn in the road ahead.

questions.info: The road is slippery when wet. Reduce speed and drive with caution.

options.text: You are entering a snowbelt area.

questions.info: The right lane ends ahead and you are required to merge with traffic in the lane to the left if you are in the left lane.

options.text: Road has a bend to the right.
Road turns sharply to the right.

questions.info: Bicycle crossing ahead so slow down and proceed with caution.
The bridge ahead will lift or swing up to let boats pass.

options.text: Bridge lifts ahead to let boats pass.
Do not drive on bridge ahead.

questions.info: Two lanes are merging into one. Merging is the equal responsibility of drivers in both lanes.

options.text: Two lanes will merge to one. Driver on the right has right-of-way.
Two lanes will merge to one. Drivers in both lanes are responsible to merge safely.

questions.info: Traffic goes in both directions ahead so stay on the right.

options.text: Slower traffic keep to the right.

questions.info: Snowmobiles cross this area so drive cautiously as you may not see them.
The checkered board pattern warns of danger so slow down and proceed with caution in the direction of the arrow.

options.text: Sharp turn ahead in the direction of the arrow.

questions.info: Deer may cross the road in this area. Slow down and be aware of your surroundings.

options.text: You are entering a game farm.

questions.info: You will be approaching a traffic light ahead. Slow down as you may have to stop.
The road has a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be prepared to shift into a lower gear to slow down your vehicle.

options.text: There is a steep hill ahead.
You are in a mountain zone.

questions.info: Truck entrance is on the side of the road where the truck is shown, in this case on the right.

options.text: Trucks may approach the road from the right.
Trucks may approach the road from the left.

questions.info: If driving a tall vehicle you may not be able to pass. Take note of clearances before approaching underpasses.

options.text: Only vehicles over 3.9 m permitted ahead.
There is a maximum 3.9 m clearance ahead on the overpass.

questions.info: Watch for pedestrians as the roadway is meant to be shared. Drive cautiously.
Rocks could be falling so drive carefully and be prepared to avoid a collision.

options.text: Steep hill, shift into lower gear.
Hospital ahead, keep quiet and watch for ambulances.
You are approaching a hidden school bus stop.

questions.info: Watch for children crossing and follow the direction of the crossing guard. These signs may be neon yellow or blue.

options.text: Children must be accompanied by adults in this area.

questions.info: All ramps have a maximum safe speed you can travel. Obey these maximums.

options.text: There is a winding road for 50 km.
Maximum safe speed to drive on ramp is  50 km/h.
Drive at least 50 km on ramp.
Next rest stop is in 50 km.

questions.info: Some roads are near high water areas where the road may get covered with water. Reduce speed and drive carefully.

options.text: Road may have water flowing over it.

questions.info: Slow down and keep both hands on the steering wheel for best control of your vehicle and to avoid sudden shifts.
Road speed, curve and terrain may change in construction zone ahead. Slow down and drive cautiously.
Slow down and pay attention to instructions from the traffic control person ahead.
Surveyors often have to measure land in new areas. Use caution as surveyors may be near the road.
Reduce speed, drive with caution and watch for construction personnel working on the road ahead.
The road detours temporarily from what it usually is due to road work.

options.text: There is a temporary detour from the normal traffic roadway.
Be prepared to drive around mountains ahead.

questions.info: It is very important to obey the posted speed limits in construction zones as fines may be doubled.

options.text: Reduce speed. You are entering a construction zone.

questions.info: The pavement has been grooved so you may not be able to stop easily. Obey all posted speed limits for this area.

options.text: There are grooves in the pavement.

questions.info: Reduce your speed when merging with traffic in the lane shown by the arrow.

options.text: Lane is closed. Move into lane directed by arrow and merge with traffic.
Lane is open. Adjust speed for construction zone.

questions.info: Lane ahead is closed and you must merge with traffic in the lane that is open. Obey all posted speed limits.

options.text: Lane ends and is closed for roadwork.

questions.info: Always follow the arrows with flashing lights as they indicate which direction to follow.

options.text: Follow the road in the direction shown.
Watch for farm vehicles approaching from the left.
Construction zone begins to the left.

questions.info: These signs may be held by road work personnel. Drive slowly and be prepared to stop.

options.text: Stop and drive slowly through campground.
Obey the crossing guard with the signs they hold up
Slow down and be prepared to stop.
Slow down, stop and exit the construction zone.

questions.info: Do not pass vehicles with this flashing sign.

options.text: Pass the pace vehicle only when you see this sign flashing.
Do not pass the pace vehicle that has this sign flashing.

questions.info: Follow this sign through the detour until you come to the regular road.

options.text: The road detours so follow this sign until you come to the regular road.
Follow the detour marker only if you choose not to take the regular road.
Merge with road that is closed.
Lane closed ahead. Slow down and merge with traffic.

questions.info: Exit signs indicate which lane to drive in if you want to exit or if you want to stay on the main road.

options.text: An exit sign telling you which lane to drive in if you want to exit to Brennon Street.
Two right lanes must exit to Brennon Street.
Only the right lane exits to Brennon Street.
No left turns on Brennon Street.

questions.info: Advance signs are also used with exit signs. Ensure you are in the correct lane to exit a highway.

options.text: A highway exit is coming up in 20 km.
A highway exit is coming up in 10 km.
An advance exit sign telling you which lanes go off the highway.
An advance exit sign telling you 2 right lanes do not exit off the highway.

questions.info: This direction and information sign tells you which direction to travel to get to the city or town posted.

options.text: Indicates which direction to go for the city or town posted.
All towns or cities posted on this sign are 50 km away.
Construction ahead so be prepared to detour by direction shown.
Indicates there is provincial park in the city or town posted.

questions.info: Sign tells you the distance, in kilometres, from the city or town posted. Helps with rest stops and gas planning.

options.text: Indicates which direction to go for the city or town posted.
Indicates distance, in kilometres, to the city or town posted.
Indicates the distance to campgrounds and green conservation areas.
Indication by distance shown that London is before Kitchener.
One left lane exits off the highway.
Two left lanes exits off the highway.
Right lane only exits off the highway.
One or more lanes allow you to exit off the highway.

questions.info: Highways are connected and in this case you get to the Q.E.W. by way of (via) the 403.

options.text: To get to the Q.E.W. go by way of the 403
Both the Q.E.W. and the 401 are coming up on the right.
The Q.E.W. is coming up on the right.
The 401 is coming up on the right.

questions.info: Highways 401 begins in Windsor so interchange 204, Trafalgar Rd., is 204 km from Windsor.

options.text: It is 20.4 km to Trafalgar Rd.
You will be approaching interchange 204 in 1 km.
You will be approaching the Traflagar Rd. exit in 204 km.

questions.info: These signs inform drivers about current driving conditions so that alternative routes can be taken.

options.text: Traffic bulletin signs change with updates on traffic, delays and lane closures.
Traffic bulletin signs post the same information on traffic, delays and lane closures.
Informs drivers about nearby parks and recreation information.

questions.info: Follow these signs to get to an airport.

options.text: Indicates you are under a fly zone.

questions.info: Follow these signs to get to a ferry service.
Indicates what services and facilities are available off the road. Other services can include car pool lots, universities, etc.

options.text: Indicates there are police, a hospital, an information desk and an airport in one building.
Indicates there is only an airport nearby.
Shows what services and facilities are not available nearby or off-road.
Shows what services and facilities are located nearby or off-road.

questions.info: Indicates there are ramps and other wheelchair accessible facilities.

options.text: Indicated retirement living community. Slow down and keep noise low.
Indicates there is a hospital nearby.

questions.info: Indicates route to where passengers can be met or dropped off at the railway station.
All vehicles moving less than 40 km/h must display a slow-moving vehicle sign at rear if driving on a road.

options.text: Speed in area is very slow, less than 40 km/h.
Slow-moving vehicle on road, travelling less than 40 km/h.
Danger, keep out, road under construction.

questions.info: Bilingual signs have two languages on one sign. Sometimes, there may be two signs, one English and one French.

options.text: Bilingual signs are for educational purposes only.
Bilingual signs are posted near French schools for you to follow.
Obey bilingual sign only if you read and speak French.
Bilingual signs provide important information. Read message in language understood best.

questions.info: The numbering system at the bottom of some signs is to help emergency vehicles plan the best route.

options.text: Two exits exist for Bowesville Road.
Only exit onto Bowesville Road if you drive an emergency vehicle.
Numbers at the bottom assist emergency vehicles to plan best routes.
Some information signs have numbers at the bottom to assist you with exits and distances.
You may not stop for any reason.
You may stop temporarily to load or unload passengers but not merchandise.
You may stop temporarily to load or unload merchandise but not passengers.
You may stop temporarily to load or unload passengers or merchandise.
You may not stop for any reason.
You may stop temporarily to load or unload passengers but not merchandise.
You may stop temporarily to load or unload merchandise but not passengers.
You may stop temporarily to load or unload passengers or merchandise.
